snippet: The Howard Hughes Corporation, which controls the South Street Seaport under a lease with the city, says it wants to enliven the area and establish a destination for both tourists and New Yorkers.
abstract: Howard Hughes Corp, which controls South Street Seaport under lease with New York City, announces major redevelopment of area's cobblestone streets, 19th-century brick buildings and piers; project would include reconstruction of landmark Tin Building and the addition of a marina and a 50-story hotel and apartment tower.
lead_paragraph: The Howard Hughes Corporation, which controls the South Street Seaport under a lease with the city, says it wants to enliven the area and establish a destination for both tourists and New Yorkers.

headline.main: Plan to Redevelop South Street Seaport Includes Marina and 50-Story Tower
headline.print_headline: Plan to Redevelop South Street Seaport Includes Marina and 50-Story Tower
